newsitem.title: USA: PRESS DIGEST - Daily Variety - May 23.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Daily Variety - May 23.

text.p: The following stories appeared in Friday's Daily Variety:
* The head of CBS television, Peter Lund, has resigned after losing in a power struggle over control of its TV station group.
* Visual effects house Digital Domain, which is responsible for work on "Titanic," will not be making much, if any, money from the job, one of its founding owners, Chief Executive Scott Ross said.

* Andrew Kevin Walker, who wrote the script for the movie "Seven," has just sold the dark and edgy "8 Millimeter" to Sony Corp's Columbia Pictures for what sources said was $750,000 against $1.25 million.
* Sony Pictures has pushed up the release of "My Best Friend's Wedding," starring Julia Roberts, to June 20 from June 27.
* International Creative Management talent agent Michael Black is leaving to become a manager in a joint venture with Suzanne de Passe.
* America's major film companies at the 50th Cannes Film Festival made it clear they were hoping to increase their profile in Europe after a generation-long absence.
